We are a family taking children to travel. Please give some travel precautions.

Certainly! Here are some general travel precautions to keep in mind when traveling with children:

1. Make sure you have all necessary travel documents, including passports, visas, and health certificates if required.
2. Be aware of any travel advisories or warnings issued by your country's government for the destination you are traveling to.
3. Research the local customs and laws of the destination you are visiting and educate your children on what is acceptable and what is not.
4. Always keep a close eye on your children, especially in crowded areas and public transportation.
5. Bring any necessary medication or medical equipment for your children, and be aware of any local pharmacies or hospitals in case of an emergency.
6. Keep important phone numbers and contact information on hand, such as the phone number of your hotel and the local embassy.
7. Be mindful of the food and water your children consume to avoid any potential illnesses.
8. Keep your valuables secure and be cautious of pickpocketing or theft in busy tourist areas.

By taking these precautions, you can help ensure a safe and enjoyable trip for your family.

China is a vast and diverse country with a rich history and culture, offering countless opportunities for exploration and adventure. Here are some must-visit tourist destinations and cities to include in your 14-day itinerary:

1. Beijing: Visit the Great Wall of China, the Forbidden City, and the Temple of Heaven. Take a rickshaw tour of the Hutongs to experience traditional Beijing architecture and local culture.
2. Xi'an: Visit the Terracotta Warriors and Horses, one of the most famous archaeological sites in the world. Explore the ancient city walls and Muslim Quarter for a taste of the local culture and cuisine.
3. Shanghai: Experience the futuristic skyline and vibrant nightlife of China's largest city. Visit the iconic Oriental Pearl Tower, the Bund, and Yu Garden.
4. Guilin: Cruise along the Li River to see the stunning karst landscape and picturesque villages. Take a bike ride through the rice paddies and explore the Reed Flute Cave.
5. Chengdu: Visit the Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding to see these iconic animals up close. Explore the ancient Jinli Street for a taste of the local Sichuan culture and cuisine.
6. Hangzhou: Take a boat ride on the scenic West Lake and visit the Lingyin Temple, one of China's most famous Buddhist temples. Explore the tea fields and enjoy a cup of Dragon Well tea, one of China's most famous teas.
7. Lhasa: Visit the Potala Palace, the former residence of the Dalai Lama, and explore the Jokhang Temple, one of the most sacred temples in Tibet. Take a walk around the Barkhor Street for a glimpse of local Tibetan culture.

These are just a few of the many destinations to visit in China. Make sure to research the local customs and laws of each location, as well as any necessary travel documents, before your trip.

China has a rich history and there are numerous historical cities that you can visit. Here are some of the popular historical cities you can consider:

1. Beijing - The capital city is known for its history and is home to some of the most significant landmarks in China, such as the Great Wall, Forbidden City, and Temple of Heaven.
2. Xi'an - Xi'an is a city in the northwest known for its historical significance. It was once the capital city of China and is home to the Terracotta Army, which is one of the greatest archaeological discoveries in the world.
3. Nanjing - Nanjing is located in the eastern part of China and has a rich history dating back to 3,000 years. The city was once the capital city of several dynasties, including the Ming dynasty, and is home to many historic sites, including the Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum and the Nanjing City Wall.
4. Luoyang - Located in Henan Province, Luoyang was once the capital of 13 dynasties and is home to many historical sites such as the Longmen Grottoes, White Horse Temple, and Shaolin Temple.
5. Suzhou - Suzhou is a beautiful city known for its classical Chinese gardens and canals. It has a history dating back over 2,500 years and was once an important city for trade and commerce.
6. Hangzhou - Hangzhou was the capital of the Southern Song dynasty and is known for its beautiful West Lake and Longjing tea plantations. The city has a history dating back over 2,200 years.

These are just some of the many historical cities you can visit in China. Each city has its unique history, architecture, and culture, which makes for an enriching experience.

If you have 14 days to travel in Xi'an, here is a suggested itinerary that includes surrounding cities and popular tourist attractions:

Day 1: Arrival in Xi'an
Arrive in Xi'an, check into your hotel, and rest. In the evening, take a stroll around the Muslim Quarter, a bustling and lively neighborhood famous for its street food and local souvenirs.

Day 2: Xi'an City Tour
Visit the Terracotta Army, one of the most famous archaeological sites in the world, and learn about the history of the Qin Dynasty. In the afternoon, visit the ancient city walls, the Bell Tower, and the Drum Tower. End the day with a Tang Dynasty dinner show.

Day 3: Xi'an City Tour
Visit the Shaanxi History Museum, one of the best museums in China, to learn about the history and culture of Xi'an. In the afternoon, visit the Great Mosque and the Grand Mosque Quarter, which is the largest mosque in China.

Day 4: Luoyang City Tour
Take a high-speed train to Luoyang, which is known for its Longmen Grottoes, a UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring over 100,000 Buddhist statues carved into caves. You can also visit the White Horse Temple, one of the oldest Buddhist temples in China.

Day 5: Luoyang City Tour
Visit the Shaolin Temple, which is located in the nearby Songshan Mountains and is famous for its kung fu monks. You can watch a kung fu performance and explore the temple complex.

Day 6: Pingyao City Tour
Take a high-speed train to Pingyao, which is a well-preserved ancient city that is also a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Visit the Pingyao Ancient City Wall, Rishengchang Draft Bank Museum, and the Qiao Family Compound.

Day 7: Pingyao City Tour
Visit the Shuanglin Temple, a Buddhist temple that is famous for its over 2,000 painted clay figurines. You can also explore the local food and souvenirs in the old town.

Day 8: Hukou Waterfall Tour
Take a day trip to the Hukou Waterfall, which is the second-largest waterfall in China and is located on the Yellow River. You can take a boat ride and hike to get the best views.

Day 9: Xi'an City Tour
Return to Xi'an and visit the Small Wild Goose Pagoda and the Xi'an Museum. You can also walk around the Bell and Drum Tower Square, which is a popular spot for locals and tourists.

Day 10: Huashan Mountain Tour
Take a day trip to Huashan Mountain, which is one of China's five sacred mountains and is known for its steep cliffs and stunning views. You can take a cable car and hike to the summit.

Day 11: Famen Temple Tour
Visit the Famen Temple, which is famous for its Buddhist relics, including the finger bone of Sakyamuni Buddha. You can also explore the local area and visit the Yaozhou Kiln Ruins.

Day 12-13: Xi'an City Tour
Spend the last two days in Xi'an exploring any other attractions that you may have missed, such as the Banpo Museum or the Forest of Steles Museum. You can also walk around the ancient city walls or rent a bike and explore the local area.

Day 14: Departure from Xi'an
Check out of your hotel and depart from Xi'an to your next destination.

This itinerary is just a suggestion and can be adjusted based on your preferences and interests. Make sure to research any travel requirements and book accommodations and transportation in advance.
